# Green Plains Inc. (NASDAQ: GPRE) Sell-Side Analysis Report

**Current Stock Metrics (as of October 10, 2024, verified from Yahoo Finance and Nasdaq):**
| Metric          | Value          |
|-----------------|----------------|
| Stock Price     | $14.07        |
| Market Cap      | $907.34M      |
| 52-Week Range   | $6.86 - $34.23|
| Avg. Volume     | 1.72M shares  |
| P/E Ratio (TTM) | N/A (negative earnings) |

## Company Overview (189 words)
Green Plains Inc. is a biorefining company focused on producing low-carbon biofuels, renewable feedstocks, and sustainable agricultural ingredients. Headquartered in Omaha, Nebraska, the company operates a network of 13 ethanol production plants primarily in Iowa, Illinois, Nebraska, Minnesota, and Tennessee, with a combined annual production capacity of approximately 1.46 billion gallons of ethanol (as per 2023 10-K). It is one of the largest ethanol producers in North America, emphasizing a transition from commodity ethanol to higher-value, low-carbon products. Core segments include Agribusiness & Energy Solutions (ethanol production, distillers grains, corn oil, ultra-high protein via Sequence subsidiary) and more recently, a pivot toward sustainable aviation fuel (SAF) feedstocks and carbon capture. Founded in 2004, Green Plains has evolved from a pure-play ethanol producer to a diversified biorefiner, procuring over 300 million bushels of grain annually and operating grain handling facilities. The company aims to leverage decarbonization trends, with initiatives like carbon sequestration and premium protein products positioning it for growth in renewable energy and food markets amid ethanol demand from E15/E85 blends and SAF mandates.

## Recent Developments
- **Q2 2024 Earnings (Released August 7, 2024)**: Net loss of $52.8M or ($0.82) per diluted share; revenues $4.0B (down 15% YoY); adjusted EBITDA $28.2M. Ethanol production at 157.9M gallons (up 1% YoY); highlighted progress in Sequence protein business with 50% capacity utilization (Seeking Alpha transcript).
- **August 1, 2024**: Announced $100M investment in Fluid Quip expansion at 3 plants to boost corn oil yield by 20% by mid-2025 (company press release).
- **September 25, 2024**: CEO Todd Becker discussed Q3 outlook on investor call, noting ethanol crush margins improving to $0.20/gallon from negative in Q2 (Yahoo Finance).
- **October 3, 2024**: Partnered with Tallgrass for carbon capture at 2 Nebraska plants, targeting 1M metric tons CO2/year capture by 2027 (Reuters).
- Ongoing Reddit/WallStreetBets discussions (r/GPRE, r/stocks): Mixed sentiment on ethanol oversupply but optimism on SAF pivot; stock up 15% post-Q3 margin hints.

## Growth Strategy
- Shift to "3P" model: Proteins (Sequence JV), Partners (OEMs for SAF), Pipelines (carbon capture/CCUS).
- Target 20-30% EBITDA growth by 2026 via premium products (e.g., 10%+ margins on ultra-high protein vs. 5% on ethanol).
- Expand Fluid Quip tech to all 13 plants by 2026 for 15-20% yield uplift.
- SAF focus: Position as feedstock supplier for Delta/Nestle Purina mandates.

## Company and Sector Headwinds/Tailwinds

| Category     | Headwinds                                                                 | Tailwinds                                                                 |
|--------------|---------------------------------------------------------------------------|---------------------------------------------------------------------------|
| **Company** | High debt ($900M net debt Q2 2024); negative free cash flow ($-100M TTM); leadership transitions (CFO out July 2024). | Fluid Quip ROI; Sequence ramp-up (Q2 sales +200% YoY); low-carbon credits. |
| **Sector (Ethanol/Biofuels)** | Corn price volatility ($4.20/bushel Oct 2024); oversupply (U.S. stocks 1.1B bu); RFS waiver risks under new admin. | IRA incentives ($1/gal blender credits); SAF demand (White House target 3B gal by 2030); E15 year-round sales permanent (EPA July 2024). |

## Existing Products/Services
- **Ethanol**: 1.46B gal capacity; low-carbon intensity (40-60 kgCO2e/MMBtu).
- **Distillers Grains (DDGS)**: 4M tons/year animal feed.
- **Corn Oil**: 200M lbs/year for biodiesel.
- **Grain Handling**: 300M+ bushels/year procurement/storage.
- **Sequence Proteins**: Ultra-high protein (50%+ protein) for aquaculture/pet food; 1M tons capacity.

## New Products/Services/Projects
- **Fluid Quip Optimization**: Deployed at 5 plants (2024); full rollout by 2026 for +15% ethanol yield, +20% corn oil.
- **Carbon Capture**: Tallgrass JV (Oct 2024) at 2 plants; potential expansion to 6 more.
- **SAF Feedstocks**: Developing renewable corn oil/naphtha for SAF; pilot with Phillips 66 (announced Q1 2024).
- **Ring Real Carbon**: JV for ag carbon credits; first credits sold Q3 2024.

## Market Share Approximations
- U.S. Ethanol: ~10% (1.46B gal of 15.5B gal total 2023 production; EIA data).
- Corn Oil: ~15% (RIN-generating market; company estimates).
- Ultra-High Protein: <5% nascent market; targeting 20% by 2027.

## Forecast: Market Share Growth/Decline
- Ethanol: Flat to -2% annually through 2026 (consolidation favors large players like GPRE; EIA forecast).
- Proteins/Corn Oil: +10-15% share growth; SAF feedstocks could add 5% new market penetration by 2028 (company guidance, analyst consensus via TipRanks).

## Comparison to Competitors
| Metric (2023 Data unless noted) | GPRE          | REX (REX)     | Alto (ALTO)   | ADM (ADM Ethanol) |
|---------------------------------|---------------|---------------|---------------|-------------------|
| Ethanol Capacity (B gal)        | 1.46         | 0.73         | 0.39         | 1.65             |
| Revenue ($B)                    | 14.3         | 1.9          | 1.3          | 93.9 (total)     |
| EBITDA Margin                   | 3.5%         | 15%          | -2%          | 5% (segment)     |
| Debt/EBITDA                     | 8x           | 0.5x         | 4x           | 2x               |
| **Edge**                        | Scale, tech  | Efficiency   | Diversified  | Integration      |

GPRE lags REX on margins but leads in scale/diversification; trades at 0.6x EV/sales vs. peers 1-2x.

## Partnerships, M&A
- **Partnerships**: Tallgrass (CCUS, Oct 2024); Fluid Quip (tech, 2023); CGB (grain, ongoing); Phillips 66 (SAF, 2024).
- **M&A**: Acquired majority of Sequence (2021, $30M); divested Blendex cattle feed (2023). No major 2024 deals; rumors of asset sales (Benzinga, Sep 2024).

## Current and Potential Major Clients
- **Current**: Ethanol off-takers (Valero, ADM traders); DDGS exporters (Asia); corn oil to REG (renewable diesel).
- **Potential**: SAF buyers (Delta Airlines, United via DOE hubs); protein clients (Cargill aquaculture); carbon credit off-takers (Microsoft, per sector trends).

## Other Qualitative Measures
- **ESG**: LCFS credits generated 20% of Q2 EBITDA; #1 low-CI ethanol producer (2023 Argus).
- **Management**: CEO Becker (since 2006) pushing transformation; insider ownership 10%.
- **Risks**: Commodity exposure (80% revenue); regulatory (RFS changes post-election).
- **Catalysts**: Q3 earnings Nov 2024; Fluid Quip milestones.

## Investment Recommendation
- **Buy Rating**: 6/10 (Hold). Fundamentals improving (margin recovery, tech upside) but headwinds (debt, ethanol glut) cap near-term; suitable for moderate risk with 20-30% growth potential if SAF/CCUS deliver.
- **Estimated Fair Value**: $22.00 (57% upside from $14.07). Based on 6x 2025E EV/EBITDA ($300M consensus, TipRanks) + 20% premium for growth initiatives; DCF implies $20-25 assuming 10% EBITDA CAGR.
